description: French (1896) Gospels (Louis-Claude Fillion) - Gospels Louis-Claude Fillion, a prominent figure in biblical scholarship, was born in 1843 and passed away in 1927. Ordained as a priest in 1867, he later became a distinguished professor, specializing in Scripture and Hebrew studies. His academic journey led him to the Catholic Institute of Paris in October 1893, where he was appointed as the chair of exegesis of Scripture. His expertise and contributions to the field were further recognized in 1903 when he was appointed as a member of the Pontifical Biblical Commission. Fillion's work in the area of biblical exegesis was instrumental in advancing the understanding and interpretation of Scripture, particularly in the context of the Catholic tradition. His deep knowledge of Hebrew and scriptural studies enriched his teachings and writings, making a significant impact on biblical scholarship during his time.
